artist: Artist: Thomas Zipp; Printer: Thumbprint Editions, London; Publisher: Paragon Press, London
description: 3/4 black and white portrait of a figure in a suit and tie superimposed with a loose linear oval shape in white; image bordered in green; Lender's archive #167
inscription:
Titled in pencil, LL: ffw
Inscribed in pencil, verso: 06
markings:
Numbered in pencil, verso: 13/42
Watermark: sommerset/england
medium: Photo-etching and aquatint printed in black and green
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed and dated, in pencil, LR: Thomas Zipp 06
text:
For each print in his “Black Dada” portfolio (Mia 2018.123.4.1-.14), German artist and musician Thomas Zipp began with an existing photograph of Otto Hahn, a German scientist whose research helped lead to the development of the atomic bomb. 

Zipp altered Hahn’s portrait by introducing additional photographic images and some hand-drawn passages to create a deep web of associations regarding the social and political consequences of this historic scientific advancement. In ffw, which stands for “fast-forward,” X-ray photographs of radioactivity are superimposed over an image of Hahn.
title: ffw
